metadata.Title: CVE-2023-40303 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
GNU inetutils through 2.4 may allow privilege escalation because of unchecked return values of set*id() family functions in ftpd, rcp, rlogin, rsh, rshd, and uucpd. This is, for example, relevant if the setuid system call fails when a process is trying to drop privileges before letting an ordinary user control the activities of the process.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-40303` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

telnet - 2:2.4-2ubuntu2
telnetd - 2:2.4-2ubuntu2
No subscription required

inetutils-ftp - 2:2.4-2ubuntu2
inetutils-ftpd - 2:2.4-2ubuntu2
inetutils-inetd - 2:2.4-2ubuntu2
inetutils-ping - 2:2.4-2ubuntu2
inetutils-syslogd - 2:2.4-2ubuntu2
inetutils-talk - 2:2.4-2ubuntu2
inetutils-talkd - 2:2.4-2ubuntu2
inetutils-telnet - 2:2.4-2ubuntu2
inetutils-telnetd - 2:2.4-2ubuntu2
inetutils-tools - 2:2.4-2ubuntu2
inetutils-traceroute - 2:2.4-2ubuntu2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: inetutils package in mantic is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '2:2.4-2ubuntu2').
inetutils package in mantic is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '2:2.4-2ubuntu2').
